repo.description: Powerful Tox chat client that follows the Tox design guidelines.
repo.name: qTox

body: In this PR we are removing the assertion that the logging is on, when user tries to get the friend information. This assertion causes qTox failure when the logging is switched off. - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/TokTok/qTox/478)

comment_data.body: Is this really a critical error? Should it be reduced to info or debug if this is a normal thing that users can do willingly?
To be honest, I am not sure, we even need to have this warning. If the logging is off, we can say that the history access is technically blocked. May be we can remove it?

comment_regular_data.body: Thanks, can you rebase on master? Then we can merge it.

> Thanks, can you rebase on master? Then we can merge it.

Done! Thank you!
Can you sign your commit? We can't merge otherwise. I can't sign it for you because your fork is of qTox/qTox, not TokTok/qTox.

commit.message: fix(chatform): Remove assertion that history is on when the friend details is being called.

repo.description: qTox is a chat, voice, video, and file transfer IM client using the encrypted peer-to-peer Tox protocol.
repo.name: qTox_legacy

labels.description: Bug fix for the user, not a fix to a build script
labels.name: bug

title: fix(chatform): Remove assertion that breaks friend information call.
